tokens.resolved_gloss: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
tokens.translation: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

tokens.resolved_gloss: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
tokens.translation: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

tokens.resolved_gloss: to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
tokens.translation: to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)

tokens.resolved_gloss: to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)

tokens.resolved_gloss: to fail; by implication to wear out, decay (causatively, consume, spend)
tokens.translation: to fail; by implication to wear out, decay (causatively, consume, spend)

tokens.resolved_gloss: a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame

tokens.resolved_gloss: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
tokens.translation: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

tokens.resolved_gloss: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
